Key Match Events: Brayan Rocchio homered and drove in a career-high four runs.
Tanner Bibee struck out six batters.
Rocchio hit his eighth home run of the season.
Rocchio drove in runs with a sacrifice fly and a bases-loaded walk.
Bibee allowed one run on just two hits with three walks and six strikeouts.
Bibee loaded the bases with nobody out in the sixth but managed to escape with minimal damage.
Cleveland's bullpen combined for three scoreless innings.
Cleveland scored a run in the second off Kansas City starter Brady Singer.
Rocchio scored the next run for Cleveland in the fifth.
Rocchio's bases loaded walk in the eighth was the 10th RBI walk for Cleveland this season.
Steven Kwan snapped an 0 for 16 skid with a two-run single in the eighth.
Kyle Manzardo finished with three hits including a double.
Josh Naylor exited the game with acute back spasms.
Post-Match Reflections: Guardians manager Stephen Vogt praised Rocchio for refocusing after failing to execute a bunt.
Vogt commented on Rocchio's development and good at-bats.
Vogt praised Bibee for making pitches in big moments.
Vogt gave a positive update on Josh Naylor's condition, stating he is fine and tested out of major issues.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland reduced its magic number to clinch the American League Central Division to 20.
The Guardians hold a 4 1/2 game lead over the Twins and a 5 1/2 game advantage over the Royals in the AL Central.
Cleveland has a magic number of 14 to clinch a playoff spot.
The Guardians are 62-2 when leading after the sixth inning, the best record in the majors.
Others: The series concludes Wednesday with a 7:40 p.m. first pitch from Kauffman Stadium.
Right-hander Ben Lively will start for Cleveland, while righty Seth Lugo takes the mound for the Royals.
